15#ifndef DNS_TSIG_H
16#define DNS_TSIG_H 1
17
18/*! \file dns/tsig.h */
19
20#include <stdbool.h>
21
22#include <isc/lang.h>
23#include <isc/refcount.h>
24#include <isc/rwlock.h>
25#include <isc/stdio.h>
26#include <isc/stdtime.h>
27
28#include <pk11/site.h>
29
30#include <dns/types.h>
31#include <dns/name.h>
32
33#include <dst/dst.h>
34
35/*
36 * Algorithms.
37 */
38LIBDNS_EXTERNAL_DATA extern const dns_name_t *dns_tsig_hmacmd5_name;
39#define DNS_TSIG_HMACMD5_NAME dns_tsig_hmacmd5_name
40LIBDNS_EXTERNAL_DATA extern const dns_name_t *dns_tsig_gssapi_name;
41#define DNS_TSIG_GSSAPI_NAME dns_tsig_gssapi_name
42LIBDNS_EXTERNAL_DATA extern const dns_name_t *dns_tsig_gssapims_name;
43#define DNS_TSIG_GSSAPIMS_NAME dns_tsig_gssapims_name
44LIBDNS_EXTERNAL_DATA extern const dns_name_t *dns_tsig_hmacsha1_name;
45#define DNS_TSIG_HMACSHA1_NAME dns_tsig_hmacsha1_name
46LIBDNS_EXTERNAL_DATA extern const dns_name_t *dns_tsig_hmacsha224_name;
47#define DNS_TSIG_HMACSHA224_NAME dns_tsig_hmacsha224_name
48LIBDNS_EXTERNAL_DATA extern const dns_name_t *dns_tsig_hmacsha256_name;
49#define DNS_TSIG_HMACSHA256_NAME dns_tsig_hmacsha256_name
50LIBDNS_EXTERNAL_DATA extern const dns_name_t *dns_tsig_hmacsha384_name;
51#define DNS_TSIG_HMACSHA384_NAME dns_tsig_hmacsha384_name
52LIBDNS_EXTERNAL_DATA extern const dns_name_t *dns_tsig_hmacsha512_name;
53#define DNS_TSIG_HMACSHA512_NAME dns_tsig_hmacsha512_name
54
55/*%
56 * Default fudge value.
57 */
58#define DNS_TSIG_FUDGE 300
59
60struct dns_tsig_keyring {
61 dns_rbt_t *keys;
62 unsigned int writecount;
63 isc_rwlock_t lock;
64 isc_mem_t *mctx;
65 /*
66 * LRU list of generated key along with a count of the keys on the
67 * list and a maximum size.
68 */
69 unsigned int generated;
70 unsigned int maxgenerated;
71 ISC_LIST(dns_tsigkey_t) lru;
72 unsigned int references;
73};
74
75struct dns_tsigkey {
76 /* Unlocked */
77 unsigned int magic; /*%< Magic number. */
78 isc_mem_t *mctx;
79 dst_key_t *key; /*%< Key */
80 dns_name_t name; /*%< Key name */
81 const dns_name_t *algorithm; /*%< Algorithm name */
82 dns_name_t *creator; /*%< name that created secret */
83 bool generated; /*%< was this generated? */
84 isc_stdtime_t inception; /*%< start of validity period */
85 isc_stdtime_t expire; /*%< end of validity period */
86 dns_tsig_keyring_t *ring; /*%< the enclosing keyring */
87 isc_refcount_t refs; /*%< reference counter */
88 ISC_LINK(dns_tsigkey_t) link;
89};
90
91#define dns_tsigkey_identity(tsigkey) \
92 ((tsigkey) == NULL ? NULL : \
93 (tsigkey)->generated ? ((tsigkey)->creator) : \
94 (&((tsigkey)->name)))
95
96ISC_LANG_BEGINDECLS
97
98isc_result_t
99dns_tsigkey_create(const dns_name_t *name, const dns_name_t *algorithm,
100 unsigned char *secret, int length, bool generated,
101 const dns_name_t *creator, isc_stdtime_t inception,
102 isc_stdtime_t expire, isc_mem_t *mctx,
103 dns_tsig_keyring_t *ring, dns_tsigkey_t **key);
104
105isc_result_t
106dns_tsigkey_createfromkey(const dns_name_t *name, const dns_name_t *algorithm,
107 dst_key_t *dstkey, bool generated,
108 const dns_name_t *creator, isc_stdtime_t inception,
109 isc_stdtime_t expire, isc_mem_t *mctx,
110 dns_tsig_keyring_t *ring, dns_tsigkey_t **key);
111/*%<
112 * Creates a tsig key structure and saves it in the keyring. If key is
113 * not NULL, *key will contain a copy of the key. The keys validity
114 * period is specified by (inception, expire), and will not expire if
115 * inception == expire. If the key was generated, the creating identity,
116 * if there is one, should be in the creator parameter. Specifying an
117 * unimplemented algorithm will cause failure only if dstkey != NULL; this
118 * allows a transient key with an invalid algorithm to exist long enough
119 * to generate a BADKEY response.
120 *
121 * If dns_tsigkey_createfromkey is successful a new reference to 'dstkey'
122 * will have been made.
123 *
124 * Requires:
125 *\li 'name' is a valid dns_name_t
126 *\li 'algorithm' is a valid dns_name_t
127 *\li 'secret' is a valid pointer
128 *\li 'length' is an integer >= 0
129 *\li 'dstkey' is a valid dst key or NULL
130 *\li 'creator' points to a valid dns_name_t or is NULL
131 *\li 'mctx' is a valid memory context
132 *\li 'ring' is a valid TSIG keyring or NULL
133 *\li 'key' or '*key' must be NULL
134 *
135 * Returns:
136 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
137 *\li #ISC_R_EXISTS - a key with this name already exists
138 *\li #ISC_R_NOTIMPLEMENTED - algorithm is not implemented
139 *\li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY
140 */
141
142void
143dns_tsigkey_attach(dns_tsigkey_t *source, dns_tsigkey_t **targetp);
144/*%<
145 * Attach '*targetp' to 'source'.
146 *
147 * Requires:
148 *\li 'key' is a valid TSIG key
149 *
150 * Ensures:
151 *\li *targetp is attached to source.
152 */
153
154void
155dns_tsigkey_detach(dns_tsigkey_t **keyp);
156/*%<
157 * Detaches from the tsig key structure pointed to by '*key'.
158 *
159 * Requires:
160 *\li 'keyp' is not NULL and '*keyp' is a valid TSIG key
161 *
162 * Ensures:
163 *\li 'keyp' points to NULL
164 */
165
166void
167dns_tsigkey_setdeleted(dns_tsigkey_t *key);
168/*%<
169 * Prevents this key from being used again. It will be deleted when
170 * no references exist.
171 *
172 * Requires:
173 *\li 'key' is a valid TSIG key on a keyring
174 */
175
176isc_result_t
177dns_tsig_sign(dns_message_t *msg);
178/*%<
179 * Generates a TSIG record for this message
180 *
181 * Requires:
182 *\li 'msg' is a valid message
183 *\li 'msg->tsigkey' is a valid TSIG key
184 *\li 'msg->tsig' is NULL
185 *
186 * Returns:
187 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
188 *\li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY
189 *\li #ISC_R_NOSPACE
190 *\li #DNS_R_EXPECTEDTSIG
191 * - this is a response & msg->querytsig is NULL
192 */
193
194isc_result_t
195dns_tsig_verify(isc_buffer_t *source, dns_message_t *msg,
196 dns_tsig_keyring_t *ring1, dns_tsig_keyring_t *ring2);
197/*%<
198 * Verifies the TSIG record in this message
199 *
200 * Requires:
201 *\li 'source' is a valid buffer containing the unparsed message
202 *\li 'msg' is a valid message
203 *\li 'msg->tsigkey' is a valid TSIG key if this is a response
204 *\li 'msg->tsig' is NULL
205 *\li 'msg->querytsig' is not NULL if this is a response
206 *\li 'ring1' and 'ring2' are each either a valid keyring or NULL
207 *
208 * Returns:
209 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
210 *\li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY
211 *\li #DNS_R_EXPECTEDTSIG - A TSIG was expected but not seen
212 *\li #DNS_R_UNEXPECTEDTSIG - A TSIG was seen but not expected
213 *\li #DNS_R_TSIGERRORSET - the TSIG verified but ->error was set
214 * and this is a query
215 *\li #DNS_R_CLOCKSKEW - the TSIG failed to verify because of
216 * the time was out of the allowed range.
217 *\li #DNS_R_TSIGVERIFYFAILURE - the TSIG failed to verify
218 *\li #DNS_R_EXPECTEDRESPONSE - the message was set over TCP and
219 * should have been a response,
220 * but was not.
221 */
222
223isc_result_t
224dns_tsigkey_find(dns_tsigkey_t **tsigkey, const dns_name_t *name,
225 const dns_name_t *algorithm, dns_tsig_keyring_t *ring);
226/*%<
227 * Returns the TSIG key corresponding to this name and (possibly)
228 * algorithm. Also increments the key's reference counter.
229 *
230 * Requires:
231 *\li 'tsigkey' is not NULL
232 *\li '*tsigkey' is NULL
233 *\li 'name' is a valid dns_name_t
234 *\li 'algorithm' is a valid dns_name_t or NULL
235 *\li 'ring' is a valid keyring
236 *
237 * Returns:
238 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
239 *\li #ISC_R_NOTFOUND
240 */
241
242
243isc_result_t
244dns_tsigkeyring_create(isc_mem_t *mctx, dns_tsig_keyring_t **ringp);
245/*%<
246 * Create an empty TSIG key ring.
247 *
248 * Requires:
249 *\li 'mctx' is not NULL
250 *\li 'ringp' is not NULL, and '*ringp' is NULL
251 *
252 * Returns:
253 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
254 *\li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY
255 */
256
257isc_result_t
258dns_tsigkeyring_add(dns_tsig_keyring_t *ring, const dns_name_t *name,
259 dns_tsigkey_t *tkey);
260/*%<
261 * Place a TSIG key onto a key ring.
262 *
263 * Requires:
264 *\li 'ring', 'name' and 'tkey' are not NULL
265 *
266 * Returns:
267 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
268 *\li Any other value indicates failure.
269 */
270
271
272void
273dns_tsigkeyring_attach(dns_tsig_keyring_t *source, dns_tsig_keyring_t **target);
274
275void
276dns_tsigkeyring_detach(dns_tsig_keyring_t **ringp);
277
278isc_result_t
279dns_tsigkeyring_dumpanddetach(dns_tsig_keyring_t **ringp, FILE *fp);
280
281/*%<
282 * Destroy a TSIG key ring.
283 *
284 * Requires:
285 *\li 'ringp' is not NULL
286 */
287
288void
289dns_keyring_restore(dns_tsig_keyring_t *ring, FILE *fp);
290
291ISC_LANG_ENDDECLS
292
293#endif /* DNS_TSIG_H */
